intro: Indigofera australis var. platypoda, commonly known as the slender indigo, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its narrow, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale blue to violet, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. This species is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
